lesson_html:
• Hello! - A common way to greet someone.
  • How are you? - A friendly question to ask about someone's well-being.
  • Good morning! - Used in the morning until around noon.
  • Good afternoon! - Used from noon until evening.
  • Good evening! - Used in the evening, usually after 5 or 6 PM.

items.en: It's great to see you again.
items.explanation_en: This sentence expresses happiness about meeting someone again.

items.en: What have you been up to?
items.explanation_en: This question asks someone about their recent activities.

items.en: I hope you are doing well.
items.explanation_en: This sentence expresses a wish for someone's well-being.

items.en: Are you enjoying your time here?
items.explanation_en: This question asks if someone is having a good experience.
This question inquires about someone's activities from the previous day.

items.en: Do you have any plans for the weekend?
items.target: ¿Tienes planes para el fin de semana?
items.explanation_en: This question asks about someone's future plans.

items.en: I look forward to seeing you soon.
items.explanation_en: This sentence expresses eagerness to meet someone in the near future.
This question asks someone about their experiences during the day.
This question inquires if someone has visited the place previously.

items.en: Take care and see you soon!
items.explanation_en: This sentence is a friendly way to say goodbye while wishing someone well.
